programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare finds a very special feather with bright colours, spots and soft tickly bits. Just as he shows off to his friends how it can fly and float, a cheeky bird flies away with it. Little Grey Squirrel climbs her tree and discovers the bird using it to feather her nest. Will Little Nutbrown Hare find a way to get his feather back, or will he decide that the bird needs it more than he does?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One Spring morning a cute spotty ladybird lands on Little Nutbrown Hare and seems to want to stay with him. All his friends admire the interesting little creature and he feels very special indeed. When she eventually flies away Little Nutbrown Hare follows her, wanting her back. But he understands why she left when he discovers she has lots of tiny spotty babies.

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: Timmy and Yabba are doing a puppet show for the class. But there is a surprise puppet in the show. Who is it?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The new yellow t-shirt that Sally planned on wearing for her portrait painting has mysteriously turned green. Huckle and Lowly help Sally look for clues as to how this colour-change happened. They discover that mixing different colours results in the creation of a new one. It turns out that the dye from a blue blanket turned the yellow shirt green in the washing machine. / The kids discover pieces of a large metal hand, Huckle and gang are determined to find out to whom they belong.

programme.title: Messy Goes to Okido
programme.desc: After a button pressing accident at the Fab Food Factory, a giant popcorn is on the loose in Okido. Will Messy and Zoom be able to stop it before it flattens the city?

programme.title: Messy Goes to Okido
programme.desc: Messy borrows Zoes umbrella and it gets swept away by the rain. Messy and his friends go on a white water adventure down the drain in search for it!

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: A blockage somewhere in the sparkleberry juice system that powers Berry Bitty City results in a repair crew of Berrykins invading the town with jackhammers. The girls leave for the day to avoid the noise and not get in the workers’ way. Trying to make the best of the situation, Strawberry gets an idea for the girls to have fun by holding their own berry bitty relay race—passing the baton from a sailboat race on the lake, to a steeple chase on frogs, to a sky race on birds.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry takes his blue and red robots into Dino World so that he can continue the battle they were having at home, but without Nanas scorn.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: After watching a movie about the life of a Cleopatra, the gang go to Dino World to make Patsy Queen.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Jayden rescues a loose kite from the Caribbean Sea, only to discover a parrotfish entangled in it. Meanwhile, Leo and Katie unveil a remote controlled ball for Hero who is not a fan of it. Jayden calls them to ask about the rescued parrotfish, prompting research on the computer. After learning about its habitat, they decide to return it to the coral reef. As they prepare to dive, they spot a reef shark to their dismay. Katie gets an idea to divert it with Heros ball which turns out to be a success. With Jayden in charge of the ball to keep the shark distracted, Leo and Katie dive underwater with the parrotfish. Suddenly, they see another shark fin but it turns out it’s Ranger Rocky and they inquire if its safe for them to release the parrotfish with a shark around. After learning about the parrotfishs defense mechanism, they decide that the parrotfish should be alright on its own.They successfully release the parrotfish but suddenly, the shark makes its way to PlatypusOne; however, the rangers get out of the water just in time. Back at the Garden, Katie is disappointed over the broken ball but Hero apparently likes it better as a normal, passive ball.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When Thomas finds out that the Earls Technology Fair will bring new inventions to Sodor, he sets out to prove that steam engines are the best inventions ever.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas and Edward decide to teach Gordon a lesson after he refuses to thank Edward for rescuing him from Gordon Hill, despite previously berating the smaller engine for being old and unreliable.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: During an expedition to the jungle, Smeraldo finds an ancient vase from the dragons’ age. Since he needs help to carry the relic to his lab, Grisu will join him in the mission. The job isn’t easy, as the vase is very frail and a bunch of wild animals - especially some cheeky toucans - will get in their way. But with the help of Smeraldo, Olivia and Stella (who sneaked onboard to take part in the adventure), Grisu manages to carry the precious object to a safe place.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: A shooting star has been seen above Dragontown. At it fell in the surrondings, Pr. Smeraldo wants to find it before the wind and the rain bury the stone. Unfortunately, he has a wide area to comb. Its a perfect mission for Grisu and Stella. Equiped with a metal detector, Grisu has to deal with many obstacles, among them Thingy who turns mad every time he hears the detector beeping. And you cant imagine how many metal things lie around. Not only cant Grisu and Stella find the precious meteorite, but also they collect metal waste such as an old whistle, a magnet, wire or a weathervane.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Little Nutbrown Hare discovers Little Field Mouse has a wonderful collection of interesting Autumn leaves and Little Grey Squirrel has a collection of acorns of all varieties, he decides to start a collection of his own. But Little Nutbrown Hare cant decide what to collect, until his father encourages him to realise that he has a wonderful collection of memories.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare And Little Field Mouse are surprised to find an egg lying on the ground. Blue Bird agrees to look after it and when a rather odd and demanding bird hatches, she loves it like her own. When Little White Owl hears it calling one night, she tells them all that the ‘lucky chick’ is a baby owl and she will teach her all an owl needs to know.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Brewster learns about camouflage when he repaints the lizard’s house.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Scoutbadger is detained by Edmund and asks Martis (his best friend) to take their group of friends to the hazelnut tree that Martis spotted from the top of his tree. It is full of nuts and they must collect them before the village Tomcats beat them to it. Martis is very proud of his task but on the way his ‘bossy’ attitude is catastrophic and irritates the children. Rosie decides to become leader instead but this does not please Martis at all.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob, Leo, Muck and Scoop are at Fixham Castle to clear a courtyard wall and restore a bricked-up archway to its original splendour. Leo is taken by a statue of Sir Roger de Fixham riding a horse in the courtyard and Muck and Scoop play charging knights. After the wall is cleared they hear a strange beeping noise. It turns out to be Mr. Bentley who is searching for buried treasure with his metal detector. Bentley tells them The Legend of the Silver Shield – a shield that the knight on the statue originally held but which was later buried somewhere in the castle grounds. Scoop is transfixed! While Bob and the others knock out the bricks from the Archway, Scoop decides to dig around for buried treasure.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob tells a tired Scoop to stay behind at Bobs Yard as he goes to build an ice-cream kiosk at the beach. Scoop keeps finding spurious reasons to radio Bob and make him return to the yard. Finally there’s a real crisis but Bob doesnt believe its anything serious. Scoop takes a burning bin to the beach where it falls on the kiosk roof. Scoop saves the kiosk by scooping sand onto the roof.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Forgetful Mayor Fox has misplaced the giant key to the city that hes supposed to be presenting to a visiting astronaut. Huckle and his pals try to figure out where he set it down. They learn that Mayor Fox did one thing while touring a candy factory that required both his hands - stirring a huge pot of candy goo. Not far away they find a big chocolate-covered key./When Busytown residents are baffled by mysterious door knocking, Huckle and gang discover who it is.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo discovers a reef manta ray pup in the garden. The Junior Rangers set sail to find the manta ray a home in the ocean, but what happens when Ranger Rocky gets stuck in a sea jelly bloom?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Ranger Rocky entrusts the Junior Rangers with a mission—return a mola to the ocean! The Junior Rangers take up the challenge, but find themselves having to wing it when some seagulls start pecking the mola.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon is playing with a glider when he notices the super cardboard airplane with wheels on it that Ferdinand has made. He runs over to join him, boy does he ever want to try it out. OK, but before he does Simon will have to give him a hand decorating it. And Ferdinand gets to try it out first. Simon agrees and pushes him to get it rolling. Once. Twice. And when it’s Simon’s turn to go for a plane ride, it’s too late, it’s already lunch time. But what’s worse is that when he returns from the table, Ferdinand wants Simon to push him again. And this time with Gaspard too!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: It turns out whether there are witches or not, and that it is not nice to frighten others.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry and Dolly goes to the kindergarten and the day passes fast with lot of interesting plays.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Balthazar really gets to like the unknown bumblebee girl, and with the help of the friends he even builds a house for her.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry and Dolly accidentally ruin the snowman of Balthazar but finally they build an even nicer one jointly.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry and Dolly insist on seeing an octopus. They manage to get to the home island of the octopus and in the way back home rainbow-fishes help them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The violin of the poor Cricket breaks. Berry and Dolly takes care that neither the Cricket nor the other animals remain without instrument and music.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Dolly helps Christopher, the canary who broke his wing. In gratitude Christopher takes Dolly to the island where the yellow ladybird lives.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Flop teaches Bing and Pando how to blow bubbles. Bing finally blows a big bubble but gets upset when Pando pops it.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula head off for a picnic at the paddling pool with Flop. But when they get there, they are shocked to find there is no water inside. Bing’s disappointment soon gives way to the realisation that it’s a very special pool day. With no water there are all sorts of games they can play that are usually against the pool rules.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing inadvertently pees on his blankie. Fortunately, his toy has a cape just as soft.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Coco shows Bing how to do really good Big Boos and together they make Flop jump. When Bing tries out his new tricks on Charlie he finds out the power of Boo has to be scaled down for babies.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: When Molly visits Tilda, her friend is looking for a birthday present for Rupert. In the end, Tilda decides on a blue scarf. Molly suggests sending Rupert the present as a parcel to make the surprise all the bigger. A great idea, thinks Tilda.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Ruperts sensitive hedgehog nose tells him that the weather tomorrow is going to be fantastic. He at once informs Tilda and the two friends decide to prepare a picnic. The other friends join in and the preparations last long into the night, with Molly and Rupert finally falling asleep in Tildas living room. .

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: In Tildas garden, Robin and another robin are quarrelling over an earthworm. Tilda wants to save the poor worm and distracts the birds by suggesting a competition. First, the robins should compete at cherry stone-spitting. This ends in a draw and Tilda sets the next task: pecking out a pattern in a leaf. Both birds peck out a star, so its a another tie.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: After a long quiet winter in the meadow Little Nutbrown hare announces that he can’t wait for winter to be over so he can enjoy the other seasons with their special treats to see, hear and taste. Will the sound of icicles tinkling in the wind, the taste of a frozen Winter berry and some very unusual tracks in the snow convince the little hare that Winter is just as special as the other seasons?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare follows some unusual tracks in the snow that eventually lead him to a shy little spotty deer. He plays with his new friend every day, until she has to leave again with her mother to search for food. Little Nutbrown Hare is sad to see her go, but he’s also glad that he has friends that stay in the meadow all year round.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The snow in the meadow is so deep that Little Nutbrown Hare has to stay under the Old Oak tree. Wondering what he is going to do all day in deep snow and with no one to play with, his imagination soon takes over as he creates new kinds of fun. By the time his friends reach him, Little Nutbrown Hare can’t believe how the time has flown!

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: This morning there is snow everywhere! Daddy takes Simon to school on a sled! Talk about a hilarious father and son adventure, and a slippery one as well!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo discovers a reef manta ray pup in the garden. The Junior Rangers set sail to find the manta ray a home in the ocean, but what happens when Ranger Rocky gets stuck in a sea jelly bloom?

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Wilson is trying for his Fire Warden badge and is thrilled to be given his own siren. When the fire alarm goes off, he must sound his siren and make sure everybody leaves the area safely. Wilson gets a little carried away practising and doesn’t hear when the real alarm goes off. He is given another chance and this time concentrates and takes his responsibilities very seriously. When the alarm goes off during the night, he is able to evacuate the chuggers from the roundhouses quickly and calmly.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Wilson is flown to a secret location by Action Chugger and has to navigate his way home, using Dr. Ling’s new invention – the Chugnav. When a squirrel accidentally knocks the Chugnav upside down and back to front, causing it to malfunction, Wilson gets hopelessly lost. But once he figures out that he should do the opposite of what the Chugnav tells him, he gets back safely and earns his badge!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: While out on a picnic with T’choupi and his family, plus Nina, Dad chances upon a four-leaf clover! He gifts it to Fanni as a lucky charm. As a result, convinced that he’s having a bad day, T’choupi is now determined to find a four-leaf clover of his own, to turn the tide and enjoy nothing but good fortune for the rest of the day!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: The parents are hoping Fanni will take her afternoon nap, but she’s still wide awake, playing with her animal sounds toy… Until it stops working… Oh dear! T’choupi quickly steps in and improvises animal sounds. But when he quickly loses interest, Mom comes up with an idea: they should go and find the nearby animals and listen to their cries, straight from the horse’s mouth! With a bit of luck, this pleasant expedition will tire Fanni out enough to send her to sleep…

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Picorette the hen has taken over the kids’ swing, using it as a perch. So T’choupi and Nina decide to build her a swing of her own. But getting Picorette to agree to change perches is another matter… Luckily, they’re able to coax her, with food!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Before releasing a bunch of balloons into the sky, the children write out the message they will be attaching to the balloons. Maybe their balloon will go very far and the person who will find it will respond. Charley is quite hopeful, for his is a very nice balloon! Except that…

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Sam And Julia

There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: When railway inspectors come to the Island of Sodor, they start their inspection on Thomas’ branch line. Thomas, Annie and Clarabel are keen to show what they can do, but there are nothing but problems: a stuck window in a hot carriage, naughty schoolchildren pulling the emergency cable and animals on the line! To make matters worse one of the inspectors is very grumpy. But when Annie discovers that he’s left his gold watch on her seat, Thomas sets out to return it and that finally impresses the grumpy inspector more than anything.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: When Henry hears that the Fat Controller’s grandchildren have chickenpox, he starts to worry about whether engines can get chickenpox too. Then he meets Thomas who has been splattered with mud and is carrying a wagon of chickens, and becomes convinced of it! It seems like every engine Henry meets is splattered with something that looks like spots and it’s not until the end of the day that poor Henry discovers that chickenpox is not really a problem for engines after all!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Mommy comes down with the Sniffle-Diffles and is unable to take Caillouand Rosie to the fair, so they decide to make her better, with thehelp of Nurse Daddy. In the end, they forget all about the fair, havingso much fun helping Mommy.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: On a super hot day, Caillou and Leo competitively play a lava level ofDig n Build. When Daddy tries plugging in a fan, he ends upoverloading the circuits, turning the TV and game off! As Leo andCaillou swelter in the heat, they begin to imagine lava rising in thehouse. They learn to work together to help save Gilbert from the lavaand get their game (and the AC) back on!

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!

However, after tracking down the clues and putting them together, the sounds turn out to be the voices of the workmen echoing up through air vents from the basement.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do

Mole appears and explains how the beaver is such an amazing builder... they decide to venture to the lake to learn from the beaver. Watching beaver work inspires a fun game of Monkey See Monkey Do!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey is sitting and looking up at the full moon when he hears a howl makes him jump into Parrots hammock! Mole explains that the howl is a way for the wolf to communicate with other members of its pack.Just then we hear a different howl which sounds very near. It is coming from a wolf cub. Monkey decides to bring the cub back to its pack in the tundra.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Trevor leads The Pontypandy Pioneers on a dig to get their Dinosaur Badges. Peter finds what looks like a dinosaur fossil, but Nipper the dog snatches the bone and runs off, only to get stuck on a ledge over the edge of a cliff!

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: What would we need if we adopted a baby dragon? Doodledoo explains how to draw a Fire Truck.

programme.desc: What costume Sketchy really wants to wear? Doodleboo explains how to draw a Super Hero.

Blue Bird agrees to look after it and when a rather odd and demanding bird hatches, she loves it like her own. When Little White Owl hears it calling one night, she tells them all that the ‘lucky chick’ is a baby owl and she will teach her all an owl needs to know.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare And Little Field Mouse go on an adventurous journey through the woods in search of a special Autumn leaf. They leave a trail of acorns to find their way home, but Little Grey Squirrel unwittingly collects the acorns and leaves them all lost in the woods. Luckily he is able to help when he climbs to the treetops and spies the meadow in the distance.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: At Ammas crèche a butterfly lands on Sulas painting. Bing tries to help it go outside but accidentally squishes it. Flop and Amma help the sad children say goodbye.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The playful rabbit wants to draw a big picture, so Flop finds him some chalk to create a stripy, spotty, zig-zag dinosaur on the pavement

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula find a potato in Amma’s vegetable patch with a comical ‘face’, so they take it under their wing, naming it “Nosey”. The two children look after Nosey and show him around the crèche but unfortunately Nosey goes down the slide too quickly and his ‘nose’ falls off. Amma shows them how to plant both bits of potato so that they can grow new potatoes.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing discovers a hole in his favourite yellow wellies but he doesnt want to throw them away in the stinky dustbin.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop hear the familiar jingle of Gillys ice cream van and race across the park to find her. After a long run Bing finally gets his ice cream but as he waves goodbye to Gilly he tips the ice cream out of the cone.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: One night Berry is already in his bed, when he hears some strange noise. First he doesnt care, but the noise just getting louder. Finally he opens the door when the little green worm appeared. Long time no see friend just arrived.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: One night, Berry and Dolly saw a shiny thing falling from the sky. Fearfully, they head to the depths of the forest to find out what the strange light might be. They found a star-shaped house and a girl.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Day Of The Diesels Pe
programme.desc: The Steamies and the Diesels face off in this action-packed movie adventure! When a fire breaks out on the Island of Sodor, two new firefighting engines Flynn and Belle join Thomas and Percy to save the day!

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: While cloud-gazing with Mom and Dad, Kate points to a cloud that looks like Mim-Mim, but Dad can’t see it. In Mimiloo, Kate, Mim-Mim and their friends pull clouds down from the sky to build a bouncy cloud castle. But problems arise when it starts floating away!

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate wants to build a snow fort, but there isn’t enough snow in the yard. In Mimiloo, Kate and her friends go snow bowling in the Winter Waterfalls. They use snowballs as bowling balls and snowmen for the pins. But when the gang slides down into an ice cave, Kate will have to think creatively to get them out!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi spots a baby rabbit at the edge of the garden. Taking pity on this lone animal, he decides he wants to keep it. So he introduces it to Plume and Plumeau, hoping they’ll all play together. But despite his good intentions, T’choupi realizes before long that you can’t just invite any random guest into your home…

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Nina and Dad have fun imitating birdsongs and are very good at it. Tchoupi, however, is totally unable to join in: singing like a bird isn’t his forte! Frustrated, he suggests they play hide And seek in the forest instead. Nina’s fine with it… as long as they do a special kind of hide And seek, using birdsongs to find each other! T’choupi opts for the simplest song of all: a cuckoo, with its characteristic kookoo greeting: Kookoo, kookoo!

programme.title: Sam And Julia

There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Invited to dinner at Sams house, Julia makes a stain on the tablecloth while Sams mom is away. Time is running : can Sam and Julia wash the stain and fix Julias big mistake before the dinner?

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda is a clever and intelligent mouse who lives in a tiny house at the base of the church wall with her pet Snaily and her best friends.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets are quietly playing cards on the top bunk and Turbulent is taking all the place, which annoys Girl and Poet. Turbulent replies that if theyre unhappy, they can leave HIS bed! For Turbulent, his bed is a dungeon and you can only enter with the right imaginary ticket ! To get even with him, Girl and Poet decide to make their bed become an hotel and a restaurant in THEIR bed. And Turbulent is not welcome. Nobody is happy with their place anymore. Mommy will have to find a clever way to close the argument.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Today Poet is sick, he can’t go to school and Mommy decides to prepare him a good hot milk with honey. Girl and Turbulent are so jealous and they wonder if Poet would not be Mommy’s favorite! Once they come home from school, they even find Poet in Mommy’s bed: there is no doubt anymore, he is her favorite! They decide to take a drastic decision, they will leave the house, let Mommy and Poet alone and they will regret it. But Mommy has a solution of her own to put an end to this conflict.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Rosie wants to give her brothers a surprise afternoon snack in the forest. She needs Lucien, Loudo’s father’s help. He will accompany them to the wild bees nest that she has found. However, Berry’s unexpected presence will threaten Rosie’s plans.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou falls from his bicycle whilst out with Daddy and breaks his arm. Has to adapt to life in cast, which isnt very fun.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillous family visits an old castle, and Caillou’s inspired by an old tapestry to imagine himself as a wizard in Arthurian legend.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: One day two visitors come to the Island of Sodor to take pictures of interesting engines. At first Bert finds them very polite. They drive their little blue car along the line, racing ahead of him and stop to take pictures as they go past. But they don’t bother waving or saying hello and when they drive through a puddle Bert gets splashed with muddy water and decides they are very rude. He decides to get his own back by using his steam to make water rain down on them from the wet branches, but the Small Controller is not very happy with him.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Brewster is given the task of transporting the huge tunnel boring machine. A team of chuggers helps him, but one by one they all get called away or drop out. Meanwhile Old Puffer Pete rounds up a bunch of small and not particularly strong chuggers. Brewster is disheartened when they can’t even budge the machine an inch. He thinks hard and musters up all his energy to motivate them with an inspirational chant. It works and before too long they deliver the tunnel borer safely to the site.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Wilson has to guard the safari park while the Chuggineers work at night to replace some track. His patrol is fairly uneventful until Pete rolls up behaving very strangely and talking gibberish. It turns out that Pete is sleep-­‐riding and must be taken back to the depot. Not long after, Pete appears again and Wilson rushes all around Chuggington trying to catch him. Pete happily wanders through the rhino enclosure and then pays the Chuggineers a visit. Wilson thinks hard and devises a plan - he clamps Pete onto one of the CP transporter wagons.

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Before releasing a bunch of balloons into the sky, the children write out the message they will be attaching to the balloons. Maybe their balloon will go very far and the person who will find it will respond. Charley is quite hopeful, for his is a very nice balloon! Except that…

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Hatty helps Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave pack up their Rollypods for a vacation at the seaside. There are so many things they want to take, but which items do they need for the perfect beach holiday and which items can be left behind? The sing a song to help them remember everything they’ve packed and check it all back on board for the journey home, so that nothing is left behind!

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: With just a few strokes of his pencil, Doodleboo always manages to do a funny drawing that comes to life as soon as it has been coloured.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo chances upon a dawn bat while sketching in his garden. The Junior Rangers embark on a search after sundown for the dawn bat’s cave.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The residents of the forest decide to celebrate the last day of the year with music. The ants form a choir, Dr Owl becomes the conductor, and all the little bugs create instruments for themselves. But Iris, the icebeetle loses her bells, so everyone starts to help her find them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The boys resent the girls for not telling them what Christmas surprise they have in mind for the night. But all things go well, when the surprise is revealed and their old friend, the Stargirl takes them on a magical ride on her starship in the clear night sky.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The forest friends go for a walk in the forest, but Bubbles cant stop hiccupping. His friends try to help him by giving all sorts of advice. To eat, drink, hold his breath... But none of them seem to help. Finally, Stanley scares Bubbles from behind the tree. The hiccup stops, but now Bubbles is offended by Stanley. They all make amends later, after Stanley saves Bubbles from slipping into the creek.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The forest friends decide to help the Millerbug fix his broken windmill, but the wind doesnt seem to be blowing. Zephyr goes on to save the day, by asking the Wind to help the group restart the mill. Finally, the Millerbug can prepare his delicious bread.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: At Ammas creche the children make eggy heads with egg shells and cress seeds. Bing knows his Eggy needs water, light and time before it can grow hair but waiting is hard so he tries to speed up the process.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The bunny gets jealous when Sula gives Pando more attention on a playdate. He tries to gain some for himself and ends up being pushed, so Amma show them how to get rid of the anger

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Nuair a tha Bing a’ cluich geama le fòn-làimhe Flop, chaneil rudan a’ dol mar bu chòir oir tha am fòn-làimhe a briseadh nuair a tha e dol na sgeing air an làr. An àite seo innse do Flop, tha Bing ga chuir dhan bhiona. Tha e faireachdainn cho dona mun seo ach tha e ag ionnsachadh gum feum e innse mar a thachair. When Bing is playing a game with Flop’s mobile phone, he accidentally drops the mobile and it breaks. Instead of telling Flop, he throws it in the bin. He feels upset about it all and learns that it’s best to tell the truth.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and his friends put on a show in the park. After Coco’s dance, Pando’s song and Sula’s acrobatics display everyone is excited to see Bing’s finale. When he gets up on the stage Bing is overcome with stage fright so his friends, and rainbow fairy mice, come to the rescue.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula and Amma watch the fireworks at Bings house. Sula doesnt like the loud bangs, so she wears ear mufflers. Bing, on the other hand, thinks he is brave enough to watch the fireworks from the garden. All of a sudden, a very loud bang sends Bing running into the house and hiding under the kitchen table. Flop makes special ear gloves for Bing to enjoy the fireworks show without having to hear the loud bangs.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: With the power still out in Berry Bitty City, the girls go on an overnight camping trip. Lemon worries that a creepy creature is in the forest, and the girls get the nervous bug. Strawberry turns their apprehension into fun by daring her friends to stay out in the woods the longest! But soon, someone steals their marshmallow roasting sticks, the capture-the-flag-flags and the horseshoes. Lemon is sure that someone’s out to sabotage the campout! The girls build wacky monster-traps and capture... Huckleberry, who had gotten himself lost in the dark woods.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Woodsy’s latest collection is made up of a staggering 345 pine cones that he has hidden in the guest room. Edmund is furious and asks his son to find another place for his collection. After several unsuccessful attempts, Woodsy finally chooses Loudo’s underground burrow. Just when he thinks he has found the perfect place, he gets a big surprise.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare is impressed by Blue Bird’s description of a flowery field that looks just like a sea of colour from her bird’s eye view. He visits the field with Big Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse, and they discover that everyone has their own unique view of the field, and each one is special in its own way.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One gorgeous Summer morning Big Nutbrown Hare wakes to find Little Nutbrown Hare enthralled by a story of Little White Owl’s. Encouraged, Little Nutbrown Hare sets off to make up a story of his own, but finds it harder than he thought to come up with one. With the help of his father, he finally uses some fruit he’s collected on the way to help him tell a very colourful tale.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: During a big storm, lightning strikes the lookout tower, setting it ablaze. Berry, Dolly, and their friends immediately alert the firefighter beetles. The brave firefighters arrive quickly, extinguish the fire, and save the tower from greater damage. The little team works together to repair the roof, and Eddy installs a lightning rod to make the tower safer. At the end of the day, everyone thanks the heroic fire beetles.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: The triplets are hard to put to sleep. Just as hard as Sams dad was! says Grandma. The only thing that used to put him to sleep was an old mobile, but its completely out of order...

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia dreams of joining the residences brass band, except that to do so, she must come with a musical instrument. Sam builds one for her, but Julia is too impatient to listen at her friends advice.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: When her little girl says she wants to become a doctor, mom tells her that it takes a lot of work. Surely enough, Girl decides to start training right away, with her first aid kit. Poet and Turbulent are her first patients, but the two boys are quite annoyed by their consultation. Girl tries to heal Toto and finally her teddy bears but they too seem rather ungrateful. So how about becoming a doll doctor?

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The triplets are enjoying a day at the beach with their mom. Unfortunately, Girl starts having the hiccups and cannot get rid of it, despite her brothers many tricks and advice. Strangely enough, a seagull is finally going to cure her...But guess who has the hiccups now?

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: A high-tech super robot wreaks havoc around Chuggington.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Mandy offers to look after Miss Pawdry, claiming that shes great with animals. But the cat escapes and ends up in a basket drifting towards the sea!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Mandy and Sarah are making a film comparing what dogs and cats are good at, and the cats are clearly doing better than dogs, even at fetch! But soon a kitchen fire gives Nipper the dog a chance to save the day.

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate loves banana pancakes, but Dad prefers carrot pancakes—yuck! In Mimiloo, Lily hosts a Snifferific Contest to see who has the best-smelling item. Boomer’s entry, a stinky yuckabush, covers Boomer in a smelly cloud. It gets amplified by Tack’s latest invention, which gives Boomer the ability to play smelly tag, making his friends stinky too!

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate was looking forward to all her favorite stops on a road trip to the beach, so she’s disappointed to learn they’re taking a different route this time. In Mimiloo, Kate and her friends embark on a road trip to the Distant Dunes to go sand surfing, but a series of obstacles take them on some unexpected detours!

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D) Mepe
programme.desc: When Caillou’s friends mistakenly think that his dad is a treasure hunter, Caillou feels very special until Ms. Martin invites Daddy to visit his class. Unsure what to do, Caillou pretends to be an explorer whose assistant (Daddy) must learn to be honest in order to find the treasure.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D) Mepe
programme.desc: Caillou wants his cold to go away immediately so he can play pirates with his friends. But when he goes into a pirate captain fantasy and rushes though his ship’s repairs instead of taking the time to fix it properly, he realizes how important it is to be patient with his own body.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Diesel resents being scolded when he makes a mistake, and takes advantage of Rebeccas good nature.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Over at the garden, the Junior Rangers are working together on PlatypusOne with new upgrades . Katie uses her tablet to run a diagnostic while Leo checks on the vehicle’s engine. Leos watch suddenly beeps, revealing a call from Kyle, who then sends them a selfie he took with which he describes as the coolest-looking fish hes ever seen. Leo And Katie learned those fishes are actually sharks. They try calling Kyle again but he doesnt answer so they immediately travel to his location. Once theyre there, they can’t find Kyle so Katie uses her tablet to track his GPS location. The Junior Rangers dives underwater as PlatypusOne transforms into a submarine and they search for Kyle. Soon enough, they come across Kyle near 3 hammerheads and he waves Leo and Katie. Kyle explains with a flashback and then Hero goes out of the vehicle to swim with the sharks. Leo tells them the waters are too deep for young sharks to swim at and they need to guide them to shallower water above. Suddenly Ranger Rocky appeared as he was nearby. The Junior Rangers explain their issue so Ranger Rocky calls on Ranger Joey for help. Ranger Joey gives out helpful advice, which gives Katie an idea to use the electrical current of PlatypusOne to guide the hammerhead sharks.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In a bamboo forest, Kai is controlling his drone, Kaimera1000, to test the drones moves but gets startled when he sees a beetle on the hologram screen. Kai drops the drone, and they discover a giant panda paw print next to it. Felt curious, he plans to call the Junior Rangers. Back in the garden, Leo is relaxing while Katie draws. He asks Katie to pass him an apple but Katie ignores him and tell him to do it himself. Kai then contacts Leo through his wrist gadget, showing him the giant paw print he found. Leo and Katie go to the treehouse and use the computer to confirm that the paw print belongs to a giant panda. They learn about giant pandas characteristics, such as their black and white fur and their status as a national treasure in China. They discover that giant pandas used to be critically endangered but are now less threatened due to conservation efforts. Leo contacts Kai again, and they decide to find and study the giant panda. Leo, Katie, and Hero, their dog, get ready and embark on their mission and meet at Kais location. The Junior Rangers meet up with Kai and they try to find the panda, thanks to Kais drone. They then meet up a Giant Panda who is eating some bamboos. Kai try to capture pictures but then Hero suddenly barks at it. The children then see a Panda cub starts following Hero. It tries to playfully wrestle with Hero. Hero isnt amused as the panda cub keeps bothering him. Hero then gets annoyed and runs away, causing the panda cub to choose over Hero then its mother. The mother panda realizes its cub is missing and starts bleating a sound.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Meera orders an extra-special teddy for her baby brother Nik and his teddy bears picnic.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Pat must use a giant magnet to save the day when a water tower falls across train tracks.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula and Bing tag all their favourite things around the house with stickers, but when Sula tags Hoppity Voosh Bing is upset because he doesnt want to share.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants Flop to read him a story when he has his bath but gets sad when his book gets wet. Flop helps him to understand that even though the book is wet, the story isnt.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing has a great time choosing the perfect present for Sula in Padgets shop. Its a wand and is sparkly and flashy and spinny and Bing knows that she will love it. Bing is thrilled until it is time to hand the present over.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants to try Coco’s Hula Hoop. It’s harder than it looks but he finds lots of other hoopy games as he tries. Just as Bing almost gets it right he gets carried away with spinning, trips over and breaks the hoop. Coco is upset that she can’t hula anymore until Bing and Charlie remind her of all the other games they can still do with the bent hoop.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula are in the park playing at being giants and splashing in puddles with their big welly boots. As they play the puddles get bigger and bigger until Bing slips over in the mud and gets wet everywhere. Amma comes to the rescue with a giant warm bath and a giant carroty bagel.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald is excited to meet Henrys cousin, Louie, but as the penguins catch up on old times, Oswald feels left out. Convinced they don’t want him around, Oswald goes home. The penguins suddenly notice Oswald is missing and seek him out. Henry tells Louie what a great friend Oswald is. Happy again, Oswald plays the piano as Henry and Louie dance the Penguin Polka together.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald decides to grow tomatoes in his back garden, so he and Weenie go to Bingos Bazaar to buy a tomato plant. Once planted, it quickly produces a juicy red tomato, but the next morning the fruit is half-eaten by a snail. Oswald and Weenie plant other tomato plants and the vines produce lots of tomatoes, but overnight they are eaten by snails. Frustrated, Oswald moves the plants into the house, but he soon worries that the snails may be hungry. He leaves half the plants in the garden for the snails and grows the rest on the windowsill for him and Weenie!

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: Messy is in the kitchen making a jam sandwich. He jumps to grab the sandwich from the side but accidentally loses his grip - whoops! Poor Messy, his sandwich is all over the floor! “But why do things always fall down and not up?” he asks and transports himself to Okido to find out. In Okido, Messy joins Zoe and Felix in the garden, who are stargazing at the night sky. They spot a shooting star. As it zips across the sky it starts to get bigger in size. Now it’s travelling towards them! “Duck”, shouts Messy, as it lands right in front of them.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: Its morning time in the real world and Messy wakes up to hear a noisy song bird chirping outside his bedroom window. “Who’s making all that noise first thing in the morning?” asks a grumpy Messy. He tries to start up a conversation with the bird until he realises he doesn’t understand what the bird is saying. “What’s the point of singing a song with no words?” asks Messy and he transports himself to OKIDO to find out.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: It is a sunny Spring day in the meadow and Little Nutbrown Hare is enjoying all it has to offer. As the day wears on a heavy grey cloud forces Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse to seek shelter from the rain. Will the friends let a little water ruin their fun or will they discover that rainy days can be just as exciting.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare is disappointed when a trail of ants disappears with the delicious Spring berries he’s found. He’s convinced that ants are not very nice, and only after Big Nutbrown Hare explains how the ants were probably taking the berries home to their families does Little Nutbrown Hare forgive them. And when he sees how clever the ants are, he soon wants to be like them.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The Summer meadow is home to a many amazing treasures of nature. When Little Nutbrown Hare finds a beautiful blue butterfly, he and Little Field Mouse go on a hunt for other blue treasures to bring back and show Big Nutbrown Hare, including blueberries, blue bells and even blue eggshells. Meanwhile, Big Nutbrown Hare has discovered the biggest blue treasure of them all. What could it be?

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: Each episode of centres around a narrative story, introducing key vocabulary and addressing specific learning outcomes, finishing with a reward dance to congratulate the viewer for completing the lesson.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: All the balls at Farmer Patrick Pigs new mini putt are disappearing. After much investigation Huckle and the gang track the missing balls to Patricks record breaking ‘egg laying’ chicken. / When the gold coins Mr Fix It finds on the beach disappear, Huckle, Lowly and Sally set out to find out where they went.

programme.title: Messy Goes to Okido
programme.desc: When Messy accidentally sets Farmer Fuddles sheep loose, he must help round them up in time for their annual wool shearing. But will Messy be brave enough to get a fur-cut of his own?

programme.title: Messy Goes to Okido
programme.desc: Messy cant remember where he left his favourite sock. He goes to Okido and learns how to jog his memory, but when the rollercoaster breaks down, will he be able to help Stan Tall remember where he left his screwdriver?

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: The continuing problem with the town’s power keeps the Berrykin crews digging and the girls from doing their work—especially frustrating Cherry, who is struggling to write a song. Strawberry rallies their spirits by suggesting a fun way for them to spend the day out of town: a treasure hunt! The girls divide into two teams, each leaving clues for the other that lead to funny objects. The team that collects all the objects first, wins the grand prize—a bag of banana chips from Strawberry’s Cafe that look like gold coins. While the girls have fun, Berrykins Ed and Earl struggle to uncross the crossed juice cables under the cafe floor. The power problem has given the appliances a life of their own, resulting in Earl thinking the cafe is haunted!

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry returns from a day out at a theme park and finds that Steggy is missing.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry wants to grow some roses for Mothers day but he needs them to grow in just one day so he goes to Dino-World where flowers grow quickly.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In the African grasslands, Jane and Zumi engage in a friendly race that takes a turn for the worse when Zumi is bitten by a Puff Adder. Distressed, Jane calls for help, prompting Leo, Katie, and Hero to rush to the scene. Upon arrival, they find Zumi weakened by the snakebite, and Katie administers antivenom to aid her recovery. Leo and Hero embark on a suspenseful search for the Puff Adder, leading to a heart-stopping encounter. With Ranger Rockys timely intervention, the Puff Adder retreats into the grass, ensuring everyones safety. Recognizing the snake-infested environment, Katie identifies a snake-free zone in the desert for everyone’s safety. Ranger Rocky stays with Jane and Zumi for added protection, while Leo, Katie, and Hero bid them farewell. Back in the treehouse, the mission concludes with Leo hanging up a picture of the Puff Adder and a comical sock search initiated by Katie and Hero, ultimately earning praise from Ranger Rocky and a surprise appearance of the missing sock.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Annie and Clarabel are always complaining to Thomas about going too fast. Thomas likes to tease them, by going too fast or too slow (so Annie and Clarabel will ask him to go faster again). But when Annie and Clarabel find themselves coupled to Caitlin by mistake, they get a taste of what going fast is really like, and poor Thomas gets frightened that they might be taken to the mainland forever.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: A delivery of pipes is being unloaded at Brendam Docks. But the engines start to hear scary spooky noises and soon Salty has them all convinced that it’s the sound of the Flatbeds of Fear. Only Emily insists that there must be a sensible explanation, until she hears the sound herself and gets frightened. But it turns out Emily was right about their being a sensible explanation. The sound was just air blowing over the pipes!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Toramento is exhausted because of his job, so Grisu tries to help him by boosting a malfunctioning and slow cleaning robot to do the job in his place. But the boosted robot is not easy to control and makes a mess all around the city, also because Thingy wants to play with it, sending the machine haywire. Eventually Grisu understands that Toramento doesn’t need a robot doing the job in his place, but a care-giving device that provides coffee and massages, keeping his stamina up.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Checking the safety items at the watch tower in the forest, Emma realizes that the alarm system doesnt work anymore. Grisu suggest using the old fire station alarm bell. Great idea! Unfortunately, David, whos supposed to set it up, is called for an intervention and must leave. Grisu offers his help.Here is Grisu and Stella heading to the forest with the old bell on a cart. The noisy bell creates some confusion in the forest since everybody thinks theres a fire. Not mentioning Michel, Gertruds very talkative parrot who cant help but imitating every sound and voice he hears. The mission turns into a catastrophe when Grisu burns the bell… right when a fire starts into the forest. But Grisu is resourceful, as always, and he uses Michel as a spare alarm bell.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare And Little Field Mouse go on an adventurous journey through the woods in search of a special Autumn leaf. They leave a trail of acorns to find their way home, but Little Grey Squirrel unwittingly collects the acorns and leaves them all lost in the woods. Luckily he is able to help when he climbs to the treetops and spies the meadow in the distance.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Spring is coming and Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse are very brave and go on a journey through the meadow to discover the source of a mysterious – and slightly spooky - creaking sound. They follow the clues to discover… it’s the frozen lake melting, and singing as it does!

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Badge Quest is a series in which Wilson, Brewster and Koko attempt to earn a badge. Almost every character from the first season is featured in these episodes.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: As the family are gathering in food for the winter, Berry becomes ill and is the focus of her parent’s attention. Her brothers and sisters, who would rather laze around instead of sorting redcurrants or nuts, notice this. Now, one after the other, they all fall ill… with much playacting. Edmund and Margaret are not fooled and come up with a response as they have every intention of having a relaxed moment tasting some nice, fresh redcurrant juice…

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: Its morning time in the real world and Messy wakes up to hear a noisy song bird chirping outside his bedroom window. “Who’s making all that noise first thing in the morning?” asks a grumpy Messy. He tries to start up a conversation with the bird until he realises he doesn’t understand what the bird is saying. “What’s the point of singing a song with no words?” asks Messy and he transports himself to OKIDO to find out.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: It’s a wet and gloomy day in the real world. Messy is watching from inside whilst the rain pours onto his sandcastle he built earlier, it begins to melt. “Why does it have to rain?” sighs Messy. He transports himself to Okido to find out. The weather couldn’t be hotter in Okido. He greets Zoe and Felix in the garden who can’t wait to show Messy their beautiful sunflowers before the Mayor of Okido comes judge them in the City in Bloom competition this afternoon.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Red spots suddenly begin appearing on everything in Busytown from Mr. Rabbit’s mail box to Hilda Hippo’s roof! Huckle ultimately discovers that the red spots are really juice marks made from cherries falling from overhanging trees. / A teeny weeny piano motivates Huckle, Sally and Lowly to try to figure out who would own such a small instrument.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers bring a young Rothschild’s giraffe to the savannah to find it a good home. However, the expedition comes to a standstill when the Junior Rangers’ jeep gets bogged in mud.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers travel to the rainforest to reunite a Malayan tiger cub with its mother. But when the cub goes missing in some tall grass, the Junior Rangers have to put their heads together to find it.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon and Gaspard are playing Tag in the park, but when Simon keeps calling him a little baby, Gaspard decides that he doesnt want to play with Simon any more.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry visits his distant relative, Snail Sam.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry and Dolly gets a present but they start a fight to posess it. Finally turns out that they got a tandem bicycle.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly

programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula discover a new toy at Amma’s crèche, a talking ride on car. It seems like fun until Talkie Taxi keeps saying the same thing over and over again. When the taxi crashes and is finally silenced Bing and Sula use their imagination to play a game they really want to play without being dictated to by the noisy taxi.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Its a windy day, and Bing wants to fly his Hoppity Voosh kite with Flop.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: It’s bath time and Bing just can’t help adding a few more quirts of bubble goo…and a few more….and a few more, until he gets more bubbles than he can handle.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing goes to play with Sula who is engrossed in a game of ‘sparkle magic’ when he arrives. Bing wants to play too but Sula finds all sorts of reasons why Bing can’t play with her special sparkly things. Amma suggests that Bing makes his own sparkle magic stone but disaster strikes when Bing accidentally spills Sula’s precious sparkle dust.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: One chilly, windy day, Tilda wants to visit her friend Molly. On her way across the fields, she meets Patrick the sheep, whos got a cold. Tilda immediately informs Molly and together the two mice knit Patrick a nice warm scarf. Patrick is overjoyed, but now all the other sheep want scarves too. Now Tilda and Molly have to call her friends in to help.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda is a clever and intelligent mouse who lives in a tiny house at the base of the church wall with her pet Snaily and her best friends.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda finds a bottle containing a treasure map in the stream. She excitedly shows Rupert her discovery and the two go on a treasure hunt. They turn Wild Rose Lane on its head, but theres no treasure to be found. After hours of searching in vain, the pair recover with a tasty picnic in Tildas garde, where Tilda finally decodes the complicated map.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: On a cold but sunny morning in the middle of Winter, Little Nutbrown Hare discovers his friends ice-skating on the frozen pond. He decides to give it a try but slips, slops and slides all over the ice. Will he persevere for long enough to be able to perfect his own unique style, or will he be put off by the natural skill of his friends?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse go on a long trip with Big Nutbrown Hare to find some food he hid away during the warmer months. Little Nutbrown Hare plays with a stick along the way, which turns out to have many uses, one of which is helping them find the food and another is finding their way home again.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare is very proud of a Christmas Tree he has built from pine cones. So proud, that when Little Field Mouse accidentally knocks it over he has trouble forgiving her. When he makes a mistake of his own, Big Nutbrown Hare forgives him immediately, and he understands how important it is to forgive.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Its Ferdinands birthday and so he gets to decide everything he does today! But Simon and Lou think hes overdoing it. Are they going to play along with this until the end of the day?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Ranger Rocky entrusts the Junior Rangers with a mission—return a mola to the ocean! The Junior Rangers take up the challenge, but find themselves having to wing it when some seagulls start pecking the mola.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn their Snow Rescue badges, Koko and Wilson have to rescue Zephie, who is pretending to be stranded. They start to bicker about the best way to do it, causing Zephie to tip over. Now they have to do a real rescue! They realise they will need to work as a team and, using Calley’s rescue wagon, they get Zephie back on her wheels and earn their badges.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Koko and Wilson have to load their cars with special blocks and bring them back to Vee without dropping any or leaving any behind. They think this is the easiest badge ever – until they see that the blocks are oddly shaped and won’t all fit into the cars! Eventually they realise that if they slot the blocks together to make cubes, they fit into the cars perfectly. They deliver the load to Vee and earn their badges!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When T’choupi leaves the gate to the goats pen unlatched, one of the baby goats goes missing! Finding out about it, he’s anxious it might get into difficulties while out on its own. Benedicte suggests they follow its trail of droppings to track it down. And so off they go on a goat dung treasure hunt through the forest!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Nina are planning to go on a picnic with Nina’s donkey Coquelicot but the animal is stubbornly refusing to leave its enclosure! So the two friends decide to pamper it to get it to loosen up, hoping it will then be more inclined to move! But it’s no good: the nervous donkey simply refuses to budge an inch!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: This morning, T’choupi notices that the pretty drawing Lalou sent him through the mail has been chewed! But who’s the culprit?! Nina argues that none of her animals could have done it but T’choupi is certain it’s one of the pets at Nina’s house. And he’s determined to find out which one! He gets a surprise when he finds out that the little nibbler is not a usual suspect!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: In groups of twos, the pupils draw their life-sized silhouettes. Charley lies on the floor while Ben traces the outline of his body with some chalk. Charley looks as flat as a pancake. But Ben suddenly gets the hiccups and completely deforms poor Charley’s silhouette… it’s ruined! When the roles are reversed and it is Charley’s turn to draw Ben, there is vengeance in the air…

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Uncle Ramstout stored boxes in Sam and Julias secret lair. To avoid being invaded and lose their privacy, they must find a way to clear out his workshop in order to make room for those boxes.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: Oliver’s brake van, Toad, is in a cheery mood so he starts singing, which Oliver thinks sounds awful. And when Toad spots a stranded whale on the beach, Oliver doesn’t believe him. Luckily Thomas does. He thinks the whale needs help. So they tell the Fat Controller who alerts the Search and Rescue Centre. Flynn and Belle keep the whale wet and Butch tries to drag it back to the water, but the tide is too far out and it’s decided to transport the whale by rail to Brendam Docks to release it back into the water there. Oliver carries the whale on a flatbed and Toad sings to it to keep it calm.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: Percy is late to collect some sheep for an agricultural fair and bumps the wagon in his rush to be coupled up, backing into other trucks behind him. Percy is in such a hurry to collect the sheep that he doesn’t realise that there is a hole now at the back of the wagon. One by one the sheep escape without Percy realising. Thomas passes Percy and discovers the sheep and is forced to top and collect them. But the only place for the sheep to ride is in Annie or Clarabel!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: When Caillous Scout Troop arrive for their first outdoor adventure, he finds himself a little worried of spending the night in a tent, because he is afraid of the dark! However, he soon learns that Clementine is also scared - of bugs! Everyone is afraid of something, and together they just might find a way to conquer both their fears.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: After ignoring Daddys words of caution, Caillou climbs a tree,breaking a branch and unknowingly hurting Gilbert. Caillou learnsto be more considerate of others needs as he helps nurse Gilbertback to full health.

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave make up their own fairy story in Fairytale Land. They create great characters, like Ruff-Ruff the brave knight, Tweet the fairy princess and Dave the wise panda-wizard. They add some magic, a dragon to chase, a castle and a party, but there are many problems to solve before their ‘happily ever after’ ending!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: A trip to Bouncy Land sparks off a competition between Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave to find out who can bounce the highest. When Hatty’s hat gets stuck up a tree, Ruff-Ruff jumps up to retrieve it, proving he really is the bounciest bouncer.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Parrot is trying to rest when deflating balloons whiz by and we see monkey trying unsuccessfully to inflate balloons. Mole appears and tells them of how the puffer fish knows inflates like a balloon. Under the ocean Monkey sees Puffer fish inflated but when Parrot looks at the fish its deflated until finally they both see him and invite him to play Monkey See Monkey Do!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Parrot is couching Monkey, after some jumping jacks Parrots asks him to kick a punching bag. Monkey tries but keeps falling out of balance; each time he kicks he falls back… Mole appears and tells them of the donkeys famous precise kick. Monkey is enthused to learn his technique and off they go to the farm.

programme.title: Daisy And Ollie
programme.desc: Boris the cat has such long whiskers, but why?! Why do cats have whiskers? Daisy and Ollie make cat masks and along with Daddy, Whizzy and Boo, have fun pretending to be cats in the garden. If only Daddy had made himself longer whiskers!

programme.title: Daisy And Ollie
programme.desc: Daisy and Ollie’s game of hide and seek is ruined when Ollie’s shadow gives him away. They go to find Daddy in the shed, but It’s really dark and when Daisy and Ollie go inside, their shadows disappear! Luckily, Daddy has a torch, will this help Daisy and Ollie find their shadows again?

programme.title: Conni
programme.desc: Connis family has to move house. No! Losing her friends, going to a new school, having a new bedroom? But in the end it all turns out to be good. In the playground near to her new home, Conni meets Anna – the beginning of a great friendship!

programme.title: Conni
programme.desc: Conni finds a little cat and takes it home with her. Is she able to convince her parents that tomcat Mau has found a new home? And what does a tomcat need? A lot of questions and…a happy ending?

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Winter arrived early this year, and our dear family must get ready to face the cold for a long period of time. Edmund would like to extend the burrow’s food storeroom, but the vixens believe they had better spend the day outside instead and enjoy the sunrays of this beautiful day to collect strength and energy. The family finally decides to go outside… but to work...

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Who is the hide and seek master in the garden? Doddleboo explains how to draw a mole.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Who would be a great companion to have on an adventure? Doodleboo explains how to draw a dog.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: What was a cavemans favorite attraction? Doodleboo explains how to draw a funny dinosaur

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate is making a balloon buddy for Mim-Mim and needs a big balloon. In Mimiloo, Kate, Mim-Mim and their friends find a balloon tree, but all its balloons are flat and droopy. They must find a way to re-inflate the balloons for the Big Balloon Parade, where Kate has a big surprise for Mim-Mim!

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate and her stuffed toy friends use their imaginations to go on wild and incredible adventures.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Spring is coming and Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse are very brave and go on a journey through the meadow to discover the source of a mysterious – and slightly spooky - creaking sound. They follow the clues to discover… it’s the frozen lake melting, and singing as it does!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse pick lots of delicious strawberries. Little Nutbrown Hare eats all his and runs out so Little Field Mouse shares hers with him. When he goes to collect some more for his friend he eats them all too. Little Field Mouse shows him how to eat them really slowly to make them last longer.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare makes a slippery slide from a pile of snow and has so much fun he decides to keep it a secret and play with it all by himself. But he soon gets bored playing by himself, and invites his friends to play. They build bigger and curvier slides together and slide faster and faster. Little Nutbrown Hare learns it’s lots more fun to shares the joy with his friends.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: In the absence of a real plaster, Bing makes one out of sticky tape, but it’s so sticky that it hurts when he tries to take it off.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing loves Arlo the cat. They are friends. Bing strokes the kitty and they play hide and seek, but what happens when Bing meets a cat that isnt as friendly?

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop find a patch of fluffy dandelions and blow all but one. Bing takes the last one to give to Sula but when she hugs him to say hello, the dandelion blows away.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is vooshing with Hoppity around the garden, making him fly higher and higher. With one particularly enthusiastic throw Hoppity disappears. After a hunt, Bing finds Hoppity in the washing up bowl and gets upset because a wet, mucky Hoppity just doesn’t feel right.

programme.title: Bing Bunny

programme.desc: One day Berry and Flutter played a board game. The first round was won by Berry, and the second one was won by him as well. In the third round, Flutter finished first. Berry got very angry. They played another round, but Flutter won again. Berry couldn’t help but made a scene.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: Stanley and Balthazar ruin Flutters playing cards, but seeing the butterfly girls sadness, they ask Dollys help to make a brand new card deck.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: Leapy the grasshopper makes fun of Katie the yellow ladybird, because she blows bigger bubbles than her. Later, regretting her actions, Leapy has to find a way to apologize to Katie.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Misty Island Rescue
programme.desc: Thomas finds himself stranded on a strange island which is inhabited by even stranger locomotives. Will he ever find a way back to Sodor?

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: It’s Valentine’s Day, and Kate wants to make the best valentine ever for Dad! Kate tells her friends in Mimiloo all about Valentine’s Day, and everyone decides to make each other valentine’s gifts. But they’re so focused on making gifts, they spend all their time apart—which doesn’t feel much like a celebration at all!

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: The storybook Mom is reading to Kate is missing its last page! In Mimiloo, Boomer can’t sleep because he’s lost his favorite book so Kate and Mim-Mim team up with their friends to act out the story. Mim-Mim doesn’t like being the big bad boogideebear and creates a clever new ending to the story.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: This lunchtime, T’choupi refuses to eat the fish Dad has cooked, supposedly because it doesn’t look tasty. But Mom insists: T’choupi can’t say he doesn’t like it if he hasn’t even tried it! So, when his parents aren’t looking, T’choupi slips his piece of fish to Ciboulette the cat, who just happens to be passing by at that moment. There we are – no-one’s any the wiser, mumbles T’choupi with a sigh of relief. But when, a short time later, he notices poor little Ciboulette has a strange cough, he gets worried: did the fish he gave her to eat give her a stomach ache??!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Nina finds T’choupi’s baby sister Fanni so cute that she suggests they go out and find other babies, in the hamlet. Launching a baby quest, she and T’choupi come across a chick, a baby rabbit, a caterpillar and a little snail! Next, they head to the woods to find more babies. But T’choupi suddenly gapes as he spots the cutest young animal of them all: a baby hedgehog, also known as a hoglet.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia pretended to Sam she can do real magic. To prove him so, Julia has to find a way to do that. She will have to find different tricks to let her friend believe she really is a magician.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: A butterfly has entered the hall and cant find a way out. Sam and Julia use different strategies to capture the insect and get it back to freedom. But the butterfly doesnt seems to understand.

programme.desc: Mole mother Gertrud has a cold, so Tilda watches her kids. The children teach Tilda how to dig. Unfortunately, Tilda’s tunnel leads directly to Rupert, who’s upset about the molehills in his garden.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets have a new idea on their mind, they want to be exactly the same and in that purpose, they wear masks at breakfast to trick Mommy. Their attempt is completely useless because, as Mommy says, theyre a lot different from each other. The Triplets dont agree and they want her to start dressing them identically. Mommy refuses, she doesnt want robots as children. But when they meet other Triplets in the park that day, they finally realize its not so bad to be different.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: At the end of a day without arguing, the Triplets dont want to go to bed because they want to stay together, even at night ! But the problem is, when they arrive at Dreamland, none of them wish to do the same dream. Poet wants a dream with polar bears and lots of hugs, Turbulent wants to live on a deserted island and Girl wishes to take care of little babies...

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When Duck’s driver boils an egg in his whistle it leaves Duck making a very funny sound. Mike can be grumpy and tends to overheat, but when he loses his temper with a cow later that day he blows his own whistle cap right off and into a field. Now Mike can’t whistle properly and he’s not very happy about it. He can’t see the funny side of the situation as easily as his friends Rex and Bert.

programme.title: Chuggington
